Character
Sign in to edit
View history
Talk (0)
CharactersList
Character
Type
Game Systems
Characters are obtainable units in Honkai: Star Rail. They come in different qualities, follow a specific Path, are aligned with an Element and are equipable with a specific Light Cone.
Contents
1 How to Obtain
2 Progression
2.1 Leveling
2.2 Ascensions
3 Playable Characters
4 Announced Upcoming Characters
5 Non-Playable Characters
5.1 Notable Characters
6 Change History
7 References
8 Navigation
How to Obtain[]
Characters are primarily obtained by performing Warps using Star Rail Pass or Star Rail Special Pass. These Warp Items can be:
Purchased with Stellar Jade.
Earned from Missions.
Earned from reaching specific Trailblaze Levels.
Exchanged with Undying Starlight ×20 each in the Starlight Exchange shop.
Exchanged for a monthly limit with Undying Embers ×90 each in the Embers Exchange shop.
Other ways to obtain characters include:
Account Creation
Trailblazer is the only character at the start of the game, who cannot be obtained elsewhere. Caelus is the male Trailblazer and Stelle is the female Trailblazer.
Trailblaze Missions
March 7th and Dan Heng are obtained automatically during the mission Eye of the Storm.
Herta is obtained by completing the mission Simulated Universe: First Closed Beta.
Natasha is obtained by completing the mission Lying in Rust.
Stellar Warp
Asta is a guaranteed character from the very first warp.
Simulated Universe
Herta Eidolons can be obtained by completing various Worlds in the Simulated Universe.
Forgotten Hall
Qingque is obtained by reaching Trailblaze Level 21 and completing Memory Stage 3 through Turquoise's Reverie.
Yukong is obtained by completing Trailblaze Mission A Dragon Gallant, Its Ocean Distant and clearing Memory of Xianzhou Stage 1 through To Retire Upon the Perch.
Special Events
Serval was obtained through Mail, if the player signed-up for pre-registration, before the release of Honkai: Star Rail.
Starlight Exchange
Two 4-star characters can be purchased from the monthly Starlight Exchange shop in exchange for Undying Starlight ×140.
Progression[]
Leveling[]
Main article: Character EXP
Characters gain Character EXP primarily by using Character EXP Materials, as well as negligible amounts of experience for defeating monsters.
Ascensions[]
See also: Character Ascension
Ascending characters to their 1st, 3rd, and 5th phase will reward the player with one Star Rail Pass.

Notable Characters[]

Have a major role in the game's story.
Are mentioned in playable character's stories and/or voice-overs and have enough information available to be able to generate a general profile.

Page Layout Guides
Honkai Star Rail Wiki:Messages Pages Guide
View source
View history
Talk (0)
← Back to Page Layout Guides
This is a page layout guide for Characters' Messages. All messages pages should follow the standards of this guide.
Feel free to discuss improvements to this guide through this page's Talk page, the discussion board, or the wiki's Discord server.
See Honkai Star Rail Wiki:Dialogue Guide for details on how to format the dialogue.
Note: This guide assumes the editor is using Source Editor.
Contents
1 Section Order
2 Messages Infobox
3 Introduction
3.1 Individual Senders
3.2 Group Chats
4 Mission-Specific
5 Daily Messages
6 Other
7 Change History
8 Notes
9 Navigation
Section Order
Notices
Hatnotes
Messages Infobox
Introduction Sentence
Mission-Specific
Daily Messages
Other
Change History
Notes
Navigation
Categories
Interwikis
Messages Infobox
{{Messages Infobox
|image = message image
|type = character/NPC/group
|sender = sender's name
|name = group chat name
|signature = sender's signature
|participants = group chat participants
image
The image of the messages sender. For group chats, use the icon of the messages
Name formatting is as follows:
Characters: Character character name Icon.png
NPCs: NPC NPC name Icon.png
For NPCs that do not have an icon use the generic image: NPC Anonymous Icon.png
Group Chats: NPC Group Chat name Icon.png
Most group chats use the generic image: NPC Group Icon.png
type
The type of chat. Character for playable character messages, NPC for NPC messages, and group for group messages.
sender
The name of the sender, for messages sent by characters on NPCs. Do NOT use for group messages; use the participants parameter instead.
name
The name of the group chat if it has one. Otherwise, leave this parameter empty.
signature
Provide the descriptor that is displayed under the sender's name.
participants
List characters involved in the group chat. For individual senders, leave this parameter empty
See {{Messages Infobox}} for information about parameters
Introduction
Copy paste the following introductions for convenience:
Individual Senders
There have been several [[Messages]] exchanged between [[sender name]] and the [[Trailblazer]].
Group Chats
Named Group Chat: There (have been several/has been 1) [[Messages]] exchanged between [[sender name]] and the [[Trailblazer]].
Unnamed Group Chat: There (have been several/has been 1) [[Messages]] exchanged within this Group Chat.
Mission-Specific
See also: Honkai Star Rail Wiki:Dialogue Guide
Daily Messages
See also: Honkai Star Rail Wiki:Dialogue Guide
Record daily messages here. These are messages that award the player 5 Stellar Jade upon completing the messages exchange with the sender.
The order of the daily messages is not explicit, so they may be listed in whatever order the editor decides to add new messages. Please do not re-arrange the order.
Other
See also: Honkai Star Rail Wiki:Dialogue Guide
Record any messages that do not fit in either of the 2 categories above here.
The order of these messages is not explicit, so they may be listed in whatever order the editor decides to add new messages. Please do not re-arrange the order.
Change History
The {{Change History}} template is used here.
Version number should always be included, and is the version that the messages for the sender chat was introduced in.
Minor changes in dialogue or fixes in typos does not need to be noted.
See {{Change History}} for information about parameters
Notes
Insert the following under the header: <references group="Note"/>
This section should only be included if there are notes added in any of the above sections. Otherwise, leave this section out.
Navigation
Insert the following template under the header: {{Messages Navbox}}.
Categories
Category: Page Layout Guides

This is a page layout guide for Missions. All mission pages should follow the standards of this guide.
Feel free to discuss improvements to this guide through this page's Talk page, the discussion board, or the wiki's Discord server.
See Honkai Star Rail Wiki:Dialogue Guide for details on how to format mission dialogue.
Note: This guide assumes the editor is using Source Editor.
Contents
1 Section Order
1.1 Trailblaze/Companion/Adventure/Daily Mission
2 Mission Infobox
3 Introduction
3.1 Trailblaze Mission
3.2 Companion Mission
3.3 Adventure Mission
3.4 Daily Mission
4 Start Location
5 Steps
6 Gameplay Notes
7 Dialogue
8 Trivia
9 Change History
10 References
11 Navigation
11.1 Trailblaze Missions
Section Order
Trailblaze/Companion/Adventure/Daily Mission
Notices
Hatnotes
Mission Infobox
Introduction
Steps
Gameplay Notes
Dialogue
Trivia
Gallery

Categories
Interwikis
Mission Infobox
{{Mission Infobox
|id =
|title = <!--only add if page name is different from mission name-->
|image =
|type = <!--Trailblaze/Companion/Daily/Adventure-->
|event_name = <!--Event-->
|chapter =
|requirements =
|summary = <!--editor written summary. mission description goes to dialogue-->
|characters = Trailblazer
|startLocation = <!--location as it initially appears in the mission screen-->
|world =
|area =
|prev = <!--previous mission(s), for multiple use prev, prev2, prev3,...etc.-->
|next = <!--next mission(s), for multiple use next, next2, next3,...etc.-->
|exp =
|credits =
|stellarJade =
|other = <!--{{Card|<item>|<amount>}}-->
|chineseName = {{Lang||mini=1|zh=|zh_rm=|zh_tn=}}
|japaneseName = {{Lang||mini=1|ja=|ja_rm=|ja_tn=}}
|koreanName = {{Lang||mini=1|kr=|kr_rm=|jr_tn=}}
The ID of the mission. Leave blank if unsure.
image
Images must be taken in-game via Photo Mode.
The image must hide the player's character (including Trailblazer) and personal information (username and UID)
Graphics Quality set to High
Have 16:9 aspect ratio
Name formatting is as follows:
Trailblaze Missions: Trailblaze Mission mission name.png
Companion Missions: Companion Mission mission name.png
Daily Missions: Daily Mission mission name.png
Adventure Missions: Adventure Mission mission name.png
type
The type of mission. Trailblaze for Trailblaze missions, Companion for Companion missions, Adventure for Event and Adventure, and Daily for Daily missions.
event_name
If the mission is part of an event, incude the event name here. Otherwise, remove the parameter.
chapter
The mission chapter.
summary
An editor written summary of the mission. This is NOT the description that is found the mission menu in-game, which goes in the Dialogue section.
requirement
List any requirements necessary to unlock the mission. Only include this for the first mission in a series.
characters
An alphabetical list of characters that have dialogue in the mission, separated by semicolons (do not include speakers with unknown names).
startLocation
The starting location of the mission indicated above the first step shown in the in-game menu.
world
The world in which the mission takes place.
area
The area in which the mission takes place.
prev
Previous mission in the chain (if any). If there are multiple previous mission, include them with a parameter prev2 for the second prev3 for the third, and so on.
next
Next mission in the chain (if any). If there are multiple next mission, include them with a parameter next2 for the second next3 for the third, and so on.
exp
Trailblaze EXP obtained from completing the mission.
credits
stellarJade
Stellar Jade obtained from completing the mission.
other
voiced
Include if mission involved dialogue that is voiced, remove otherwise.
See {{Mission Infobox}} for information about parameters
Introduction
Copy paste the following introductions for convenience.
Trailblaze Mission
'''''{{subst:PAGENAME}}''''' is the first/second/etc. part of the [[Trailblaze Mission]] chapter [[chapter name]].
Companion Mission
'''''{{subst:PAGENAME}}''''' is the first/second/etc. part of the [[Companion Mission]] chapter [[chapter name]].
Adventure Mission
'''''{{subst:PAGENAME}}''''' is an [[Adventure Mission]] in [[area]], [[world]].
Daily Mission
'''''{{subst:PAGENAME}}''''' is a [[Daily Mission]] in [[area]], [[world]].
Start Location
Often used for missions that are not readily available in the mission menu and require players to find it in overworld.
<gallery>
Adventure Mission <mission name> Start Location.png|Start location
Adventure Mission <mission name> Start Location Context.png|Additional context
</gallery>
Steps
Include a list of steps to completing the missions. These steps are listed to the right of the bullet point symbol in the in-game missions menu.
==Steps==
# Step 1
# Step 2
#* Step information
# Step 3
Enemies
# Defeat the attackers
#* Wave 1
#** Opponent 1
#** Opponent 2
#** Opponent 3
#* Wave 2
#** Opponent 1
#** Opponent 2
Gameplay Notes
Dialogue
See also: Honkai Star Rail Wiki:Dialogue Guide
Record the mission dialogue here.
The mission description is the text that appears under the current step in the in-game mission menu.
==Dialogue==
{{Mission Description|type=<!-- mission type -->|location=<!-- mission location area or subarea-->|<!-- Mission decription -->}}
{{Dialogue Start}}
{{Dialogue End}}
{{Mission Description|type=<!-- mission type -->|location=<!-- mission location area or subarea-->|update|<!-- If mission description changes -->}}
{{Dialogue Start}}
{{Dialogue End}}
Trivia
Include any trivia related to the mission here.
==Trivia==
Change History
The {{Change History}} template is used here.
Version number should always be included, and is the version that the mission was released in.
Minor changes in dialogue or fixes in typos does not need to be noted.
==Change History==
{{Change History|<!--Version Number-->}}
References
The {{Reflist}} template is used here.
Hide the reference section if no references exist on the page.
==References==
{{Reflist}}
Navigation
Trailblaze Missions
==Navigation==
{{Trailblaze Mission Navbox}}

Guinaifen (Chinese: 桂乃芬) is an upcoming playable character in Honkai: Star Rail.
Contents
1 Availability
1.1 Event Warps
2 Other Languages
3 Change History
4 References
5 Navigation
Availability[]
Event Warps[]
Guinaifen has not been promoted or featured with a drop-rate boost in any Event Warps.
Other Languages[]

Introduced in Version 1.0 • Released in Version 1.4[Create New History]

Welcome to the Honkai: Star Rail Wiki! Please familiarize yourself with the Rules and Guidelines before using the site. These guidelines have been last updated on July 7th, 2023.
Contents
1 Collaboration Is the Key
2 Practice Open-Mindedness & Assume Good Faith
3 Ask for Help
4 Content Rules and Editing Guidelines
4.1 Datamined and Leaked Content
4.2 Leaked Content
4.3 Vandalism

4.6 Citation and Plagiarism
5 Community Guidelines

5.3 Discussion Etiquette

5.6 User Accounts

Rules and Guidelines
Jump right in! Do not be afraid to get started. Anyone is free to edit here once they have created a Fandom account, so simply click edit and get started!
Collaboration Is the Key
Practice Open-Mindedness & Assume Good Faith
Ask for Help
Our local administrators can be contacted on this page.
Content Rules and Editing Guidelines
Datamined and Leaked Content
The following content is allowed on the site:
Datamined icons for released items and Light Cones
Datamined info for released characters
Icons/Images (no 3D models)
Traces and Stats
Voice-overs and Character Stories
The following content is not allowed:
Screenshots or videos of beta tests under NDA (leaked content)
Datamined information about unannounced characters or upcoming characters that have not been released yet
Leaked Content
The following list contains all content that is considered leaked, and therefore prohibited:
Any screenshot or video that contains leaked content, such as 3D model renders of unreleased characters, Light Cones, or unreleased character icons
The mention of an unreleased character or Light Cone's name that has not been announced in any form of official media or writing
The disclosure of the Element type, Path, or faction of any unreleased character that cannot be known through the means of official media or writing
The disclosure of stats of a Light Cone or Trace that cannot be known through the means of official media or writing
The disclosure of featured banner or the details of an upcoming banner
The disclosure of content that comes with unreleased version updates unless announced ahead of time
Any external link that provides leaked information that infringes upon any of the rules listed above
If you have any questions, please ask a Content Moderator or Administrator before editing or uploading, or else your edits/content will be reverted/deleted.
Vandalism
Any form of vandalism is not welcome on the Wiki. This includes:
Inserting false information, inappropriate or unrelated content, spam, or gibberish into pages
Removing content from pages for no legitimate reason
Inserting or spamming links to external sites
Uploading inappropriate images to the site without good reason
Editing Conflicts
Deviation from In-game Texts
Citation and Plagiarism
For more information on how to cite, please read the documentation for Help:Cite.
Community Guidelines
Behavior
Harassment
Discussion Etiquette
When making a discussion post, please categorize the post under the most appropriate topic:
General: General discussion posts that do not fit under any specific category,
Editing Discussion: Suggestions and general discussions about the Wiki's pages can be made here.
Strategies: Posts that discuss game help which can include set building, character building, and more.
Fan Art: Users can share their fan made artwork of Honkai: Star Rail. Please note that the leaked content rule is still in effect for this category.
Memes: Users can share Honkai: Star Rail memes and fan edits here. Please note that the leaked content rule is still in effect for this category.
Gacha/RNG Luck: Post screenshots of pulls, relics, and other RNG-related images.
Game Screenshots/Videos: Posts that consist of screenshots or videos of Honkai: Star Rail content. Please note that the leaked content rule is still in effect for this category.
Off-Topic
"What character is like this? (external link to random YouTube video)"
"Upvote if you agree"
Discussion of media that is not related to Honkai: Star Rail, such as anime
Discussion of current events, controversial topics (such as skin color), or politics that are not related to Honkai: Star Rail
Discussion of other games or sites that are not associated with Honkai: Star Rail
Discussion of other Wikis that are not associated with Honkai: Star Rail
Discussion of other users or user drama
Creating, participating in, or derailing threads to discuss unrelated off-topic subjects that are not related to Honkai: Star Rail or its wiki
uploading, sharing, and posting of images or videos that are not related to Honkai: Star Rail or its wiki
Welcome posts, introductory posts
Meta posts
Inappropriate Content
Content that portrays characters in an inappropriate or not safe for work manner
Content that contains hate speech, such as racism, sexism, or content that is overtly offensive
Content that contains shocking content, such as gore or is gory in nature
Content that contains an excessive or unnecessary amount of profanities
Content that contains photo epileptic or excessively loud and distorted audio
Content that contains or includes links or downloads to malware or malicious code
Content that aims to exploit and deceive other users on the site, such as scams
Users that are found to be posting borderline inappropriate content are subject to be immediately blocked without appeal.
"Please step on me"
"Nice boobs/booba/thighs"
"THICCCC"
"You find as he'll, i won't you"
Nonsensical comments (gibberish, spam)
Otherwise, any other comments that compliment a character's appearance in a non-sexual and appropriate manner are allowed.
User Accounts
Language
User Drama
Impersonation
The impersonation of other users or famous people will not be tolerated. If you have been banned and return on a new account, your posts will be deleted and your new account(s) will be banned.
Spam and Trolling
Examples of spamming include, but are not limited to the following:
Excessive repetition of a given line or sentence (e.g. "manifesting himeko alive pspsps 😀 manifesting himeko alive pspsps 😀 manifesting himeko alive pspsps 😀 manifesting himeko alive pspsps 😀")
Flooding of a comment section or the discussion section (holding down enter and causing people to scroll down past blank lines)
Intentionally creating blank posts
Excessive emoji spam or nonsensical emoji spam
Low effort comments that contain only one word
Low quality comments that contain gibberish in them
ASCII spam
Copypasta
Checklist comments will also be considered as a form of spam and deleted. Users should use their personal profile page, message wall, or blog post to keep track of any checklists they may have.
Infractions
Warnings and Blocks
If a user is suspected or found to be under the age of 13, their account will be globally blocked by FANDOM out of precautionary measures in regards to the FANDOM terms of use.
By following these rules and guidelines, you also agree to follow the guidelines defined under the FANDOM terms of use.
Circumventing Blocks

9 Other Roles
Autopatrol
See also: w:Help:Recent changes patrol
A role given to trusted editors.
Requirements
Active editor in the past 6 months
500+ edits
Has an Editor role in the wiki's Discord server
No history of recurring questionable edits
No editing-related infractions that go against the wiki's Content Rules and Editing Guidelines
Members
Advanced Access
This role is given to trusted editors whose areas of activity often require protected pages.
Privileges
Inherits the benefits from Autopatrol
Update sitewide CSS pages in the MediaWiki namespace.
Editing and moving fully protected pages and files.
Rollback
Privileges
Quickly rollback the edits of the last user who edited a particular page.
Duties
Reverting vandalism.
Members
Content Moderator
See also: w:Help:Recent changes patrol
Prerequisites
"Experienced User" (500+ edits and 30 days of activity).
Privileges
Quickly rollback the edits of the last user who edited a particular page.
Protecting and unprotecting pages and files.
Editing and moving fully protected pages and files.
Deleting and restoring pages and files.
Renaming files.
Duties
Reverting vandalism and removing/modifying content that does not follow the Community Rules.
Patrolling Recent Changes.
Reviewing and deleting pages/files in Category:Candidates for deletion.
Settling disputes between editors.
Members
Thread Moderator
See also: w:Help:Admin and Moderator Tools in Discussions and w:Help:Making Discussions a success
Privileges
Editing and deleting article comments.
Deleting comments on blog articles.
Closing and re-opening threads (Lock function).
Duties
Ensure comments/threads in Discussions follow the Discussions Guidelines.
Ensure blogs, blog comments, and article page comments follow the Community Rules.
Members
Administrator
See also: w:Help:Administrators' how-to guide
Contact a local admin if you need assistance. If this wiki's group of admins has become inactive, visit SOAP members here.
Prerequisites
Content Moderator for 3 months.
Privileges
Grant and remove the Thread Moderator role.
Block users from editing and other actions.
Duties
Inherits the duties for the Content Moderator and Thread Moderator roles.
Approve and update sitewide CSS/JS or other pages in the MediaWiki namespace.
Update Top Navigation and Mobile Main Page as the game changes.
Members
Bureaucrat
See also: w:Help:Bureaucrats' how-to guide
Privileges
Inherits the privileges from the Administrator role.
Grant and remove the Rollback, Content Moderator, and Administrator roles.
Duties
Inherits the duties for the Administrator role.
Members
Bot
See also: w:Help:Bots
Privileges
Be treated as an automated process
Have one's own edits automatically marked as patrolled
Not be affected by IP-based rate limits
Perform CAPTCHA-triggering actions without having to go through the CAPTCHA
Members
Other Roles
Fandom Staff/Utilites/Helpers
Spam Obliteration and Prevention (SOAP)
Wiki Representatives
Wiki Specialists
Global Discussions moderators
Vanguards
Fandom Translators
Content Volunteers
Interactive Map Tester
Restricted Login Exempt
